construct.name: DisTube
examples: const Discord = require('discord.js'),    DisTube = require('distube'),    client = new Discord.Client();// Create a new DisTubeconst distube = new DisTube(client, { searchSongs: 10 });// client.DisTube = distube // make it access easilyclient.login("Your Discord Bot Token")

methods.name: play
methods.description: Play / add a song or playlist from url. Search and play a song if it is not a valid url.
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "play")        distube.play(message, args.join(" "));});

params.name: song
params.description: Youtube url | Search string | {@link Song} | {@link SearchResult} | {@link Playlist}

params.name: skip
params.description: Wether or not skipping the playing song

methods.name: playSkip
methods.description: `@2.0.0` Skip the playing song and play a song or playlist
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "playSkip")        distube.playSkip(message, args.join(" "));});

params.name: song
params.description: Youtube url | Search string | {@link Song} | {@link SearchResult} | {@link Playlist}

methods.name: playCustomPlaylist
methods.description: `@2.1.0` Play or add array of video urls.{@link DisTube#event:playList} or {@link DisTube#event:addList} will be emittedwith `playlist`'s properties include `properties` parameter's properties such as`user`, `songs`, `duration`, `formattedDuration`, `thumbnail` like {@link Playlist}
examples: let songs = ["https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxx", "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yyy"];    distube.playCustomPlaylist(message, songs, { name: "My playlist name" });    // Fetching custom playlist sequentially (reduce lag for low specs)    distube.playCustomPlaylist(message, songs, { name: "My playlist name" }, false, false);

params.name: playSkip
params.description: Whether or not play this playlist instantly

params.name: parallel
params.description: `@3.0.0` Whether or not fetch the playlist in parallel

methods.name: search
methods.description: `@2.0.0` Search for a song. You can customize how user answers instead of send a number.Then use {@link DisTube#play|play(message, aResultFromSearch)} or {@link DisTube#playSkip|playSkip()} to play it.

params.name: queue
params.description: The message from guild channel | Queue

methods.name: getQueue
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "queue") {        let queue = distube.getQueue(message);        message.channel.send('Current queue:\n' + queue.songs.map((song, id) =>            `**${id+1}**. [${song.name}](${song.url}) - \`${song.formattedDuration}\``        ).join("\n"));    }});

params.name: message
params.description: The guild ID or message from guild channel.

methods.name: stop
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "stop") {        distube.stop(message);        message.channel.send("Stopped the queue!");    }});

params.name: message
params.description: The message from guild channel or Queue

methods.name: setVolume
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "volume")        distube.setVolume(message, args[0]);});

params.name: percent
params.description: The percentage of volume you want to set

methods.name: skip
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "skip")        distube.skip(message);});

methods.name: previous
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "previous")        distube.previous(message);});

methods.name: shuffle
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "shuffle")        distube.shuffle(message);});

methods.name: jump
methods.description: Jump to the song number in the queue.The next one is 1, 2,...The previous one is -1, -2,...
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "jump")        distube.jump(message, parseInt(args[0]))            .catch(err => message.channel.send("Invalid song number."));});

methods.name: setRepeatMode
methods.description: Set the repeat mode of the guild queue.Turn off if repeat mode is the same value as new mode.Toggle mode: `mode = null` `(0 -> 1 -> 2 -> 0...)`
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "repeat") {        let mode = distube.setRepeatMode(message, parseInt(args[0]));        mode = mode ? mode == 2 ? "Repeat queue" : "Repeat song" : "Off";        message.channel.send("Set repeat mode to `" + mode + "`");    }});

params.name: mode
params.description: The repeat modes `(0: disabled, 1: Repeat a song, 2: Repeat all the queue)`

methods.name: toggleAutoplay
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command == "autoplay") {        let mode = distube.toggleAutoplay(message);        message.channel.send("Set autoplay mode to `" + (mode ? "On" : "Off") + "`");    }});

methods.name: isPlaying
methods.description: Whether or not a guild is playing music.

params.name: message
params.description: The message from guild channel to check

returns.description: Whether or not the guild is playing song(s)

methods.name: isPaused
methods.description: Whether or not the guild queue is paused

params.name: message
params.description: The message from guild channel to check

returns.description: Whether or not the guild queue is paused

methods.name: addRelatedVideo
methods.description: Add related song to the queue

methods.name: setFilter
methods.description: `@2.0.0` Enable or disable a filter of the queue, replay the playing song.Available filters: {@link Filter}
examples: client.on('message', (message) => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if ([`3d`, `bassboost`, `echo`, `karaoke`, `nightcore`, `vaporwave`].includes(command)) {        let filter = distube.setFilter(message, command);        message.channel.send("Current queue filter: " + (filter.join(", ") || "Off"));    }});

methods.name: seek
methods.description: `@2.7.0` Set the playing time to another position
examples: client.on('message', message => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command = 'seek')        distube.seek(message, Number(args[0]));});

params.name: channel
params.description: Text channel where the error is encountered.

events.name: addList
events.description: Emitted after DisTube add playlist to guild queue
examples: const status = (queue) => `Volume: \`${queue.volume}%\` | Loop: \`${queue.repeatMode ? queue.repeatMode == 2 ? "Server Queue" : "This Song" : "Off"}\` | Autoplay: \`${queue.autoplay ? "On" : "Off"}\``;distube.on("addList", (message, queue, playlist) => message.channel.send(    `Added \`${playlist.name}\` playlist (${playlist.songs.length} songs) to queue\n${status(queue)}`));

events.name: addSong
events.description: Emitted after DisTube add new song to guild queue
examples: const status = (queue) => `Volume: \`${queue.volume}%\` | Loop: \`${queue.repeatMode ? queue.repeatMode == 2 ? "Server Queue" : "This Song" : "Off"}\` | Autoplay: \`${queue.autoplay ? "On" : "Off"}\``;distube.on("addSong", (message, queue, song) => message.channel.send(    `Added ${song.name} - \`${song.formattedDuration}\` to the queue by ${song.user}`));

events.name: empty
events.description: Emitted when there is no user in VoiceChannel and {@link DisTubeOptions}.leaveOnEmpty is `true`.
examples: distube.on("empty", message => message.channel.send("Channel is empty. Leaving the channel"))

params.name: channel
params.description: The text channel play commands called

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when {@link DisTube} encounters an error.
examples: distube.on("error", (message, err) => message.channel.send(    "An error encountered: " + err));

params.name: channel
params.description: Text channel where the error is encountered.

events.name: finish
events.description: Emitted when there is no more song in the queue and {@link Queue#autoplay} is `false`.DisTube will leave voice channel if {@link DisTubeOptions}.leaveOnFinish is `true`
examples: distube.on("finish", message => message.channel.send("No more song in queue"));

params.name: channel
params.description: The text channel play commands called

events.name: initQueue
events.description: `@2.3.0` Emitted when DisTube initialize a queue to change queue default properties.
examples: distube.on("initQueue", queue => {    queue.autoplay = false;    queue.volume = 100;});

events.name: noRelated
events.description: Emitted when {@link Queue#autoplay} is `true`, the {@link Queue#songs} is empty andDisTube cannot find related songs to play
examples: distube.on("noRelated", message => message.channel.send("Can't find related video to play. Stop playing music."));

params.name: channel
params.description: The text channel play commands called

events.name: playSong
events.description: Emitted when DisTube play a song.If {@link DisTubeOptions}.emitNewSongOnly is `true`, event is not emitted when looping a song or next song is the previous one
examples: const status = (queue) => `Volume: \`${queue.volume}%\` | Loop: \`${queue.repeatMode ? queue.repeatMode == 2 ? "Server Queue" : "This Song" : "Off"}\` | Autoplay: \`${queue.autoplay ? "On" : "Off"}\``;distube.on("playSong", (queue, song) => queue.textChannel.send(    `Playing \`${song.name}\` - \`${song.formattedDuration}\`\nRequested by: ${song.user}\n${status(queue)}`));

events.name: searchCancel
events.description: Emitted when {@link DisTubeOptions}.searchSongs bigger than 0.Search will be canceled if user's next message is invalid number or timeout (60s)
examples: // DisTubeOptions.searchSongs > 0distube.on("searchCancel", (message) => message.channel.send(`Searching canceled`));

events.name: searchResult
events.description: Emitted when {@link DisTubeOptions}.searchSongs bigger than 0.DisTube will wait for user's next message to choose song manuallyif song param of {@link DisTube#play|play()} is invalid url

params.name: channel
params.description: Text channel where the error is encountered.

params.name: queue
params.description: The message from guild channel | Queue

methods.name: resolvePlaylist
methods.description: Resole Song[] or url to a Playlist

methods.name: searchSong
methods.description: Search for a song, fire {@link DisTube#event:error} if not found.

methods.name: _emitPlaySong
methods.description: Whether or not emit playSong event

methods.name: playSong
methods.description: Play a song on voice connection

methods.name: _handleSongFinish
methods.description: Handle the queue when a Song finish

props.name: songs
props.description: List of songs in the queue (The first one is the playing song)

props.name: next
props.description: Whether or not the last song was skipped to next song.

props.name: previous
props.description: Whether or not the last song was skipped to previous song.

props.name: playing
props.description: Whether or not the stream is currently playing.

props.name: pause
props.description: Whether or not the stream is currently paused.

props.name: repeatMode
props.description: Type of repeat mode (0 is disabled, 1 is repeating a song, 2 is repeating all the playlist)

props.name: autoplay
props.description: Whether or not the autoplay mode is enabled.

props.name: filters
props.description: Enabled audio filters.Available filters: {@link Filter}

props.name: beginTime
props.description: `@2.7.0` What time in the song to begin (in milliseconds).

props.name: textChannel
props.description: `@3.0.0` The text channel of the Queue. (Default: where the first command is called).

props.name: currentTime
props.description: `@2.7.0` What time in the song is playing (in milliseconds).

methods.name: addToQueue
methods.description: Add a Song or an array of Song to the queue

params.name: percent
params.description: The percentage of volume you want to set

methods.name: jump
methods.description: Jump to the song number in the queue.The next one is 1, 2,...The previous one is -1, -2,...

methods.name: setRepeatMode
methods.description: Set the repeat mode of the guild queue.Turn off if repeat mode is the same value as new mode.Toggle mode: `mode = null` `(0 -> 1 -> 2 -> 0...)`

params.name: mode
params.description: The repeat modes `(0: disabled, 1: Repeat a song, 2: Repeat all the queue)`

methods.name: setFilter
methods.description: Enable or disable filter(s) of the queue.Available filters: {@link Filter}

methods.name: seek
methods.description: Set the playing time to another position
examples: client.on('message', message => {    if (!message.content.startsWith(config.prefix)) return;    const args = message.content.slice(config.prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/g);    const command = args.shift();    if (command = 'seek')        distube.seek(message, Number(args[0]));});

methods.name: addRelatedVideo
methods.description: Add a related song to the queue

params.name: song
params.description: A song to get the related one

props.name: isLive
props.description: Indicates if the video is an active live.

props.name: info
props.description: `@3.0.0` `ytdl-core` raw info (If the song is from YouTube)

props.name: isLive
props.description: `@2.5.0` Indicates if the video is an active live.

props.name: related
props.description: Related videos (Only available with YouTube video)

props.name: emitNewSongOnly
props.description: `@1.3.0`. If `true`, {@link DisTube#event:playSong} will not be emitted when looping a song or next song is the same as the previous one

props.name: leaveOnEmpty
props.description: Whether or not leaving voice channel if channel is empty in 60s. (Avoid accident leaving)

props.name: leaveOnFinish
props.description: Whether or not leaving voice channel when the queue ends.

props.name: leaveOnStop
props.description: Whether or not leaving voice channel after using {@link DisTube#stop|stop()} function.

props.name: savePreviousSongs
props.description: Whether or not saving the previous songs of the queue and enable {@link DisTube#previous|previous()} method

props.name: searchSongs
props.description: Whether or not searching for multiple songs to select manually; DisTube will play the first result if `false`

props.name: youtubeCookie
props.description: `@2.4.0` YouTube cookies. Read how to get it in {@link https://github.com/fent/node-ytdl-core/blob/997efdd5dd9063363f6ef668bb364e83970756e7/example/cookies.js#L6-L12|YTDL's Example}

props.name: youtubeIdentityToken
props.description: `@2.4.0` If not given; ytdl-core will try to find it. You can find this by going to a video's watch page; viewing the source; and searching for "ID_TOKEN".

props.name: updateYouTubeDL
props.description: `@2.8.0` Whether or not updating youtube-dl automatically.

props.name: customFilters
props.description: `@2.7.0` Override {@link DefaultFilters} or add more ffmpeg filters. Example=`{ "Filter name"="Filter value"; "8d"="apulsator=hz=0.075" }`

props.name: searchCooldown
props.description: Built-in search cooldown in milliseconds (When searchSongs is bigger than 0)

props.name: emptyCooldown
props.description: Built-in leave on empty cooldown in milliseconds (When leaveOnEmpty is true)
